channel.title: News, Politics, Opinion, Commentary, and Analysis
channel.description: In-depth reporting, commentary on breaking news, political analysis, and opinion from The New Yorker.

item.title: The Fate of Israel’s Hostages After Iran’s Rocket Attack
item.description: As Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu oversees an increasingly fraught regional confrontation, the families of Hamas captives work to free their loved ones.
item.media:keywords: Israel, Iran, Hamas, Hostages, Middle East
item.dc:creator: Ruth Margalit

item.title: How Perfectly Can Reality Be Simulated?
item.description: Video-game engines were designed to mimic the mechanics of the real world. They’re now used in movies, architecture, military simulations, and efforts to build the metaverse.
item.category: Magazine / Onward and Upward with Technology
item.dc:creator: Anna Wiener

item.title: Peter Attia’s Quest to Live Long and Prosper
item.description: The average American celebrates just one healthy birthday after the age of sixty-five. Peter Attia argues that it doesn’t have to be this way.
item.dc:creator: Dhruv Khullar

item.title: Are Flying Cars Finally Here?
item.description: They have long been a symbol of a future that never came. Now a variety of companies are building them—or something close.
item.dc:creator: Gideon Lewis-Kraus

item.title: What Is Noise?
item.description: Sometimes we embrace it, sometimes we hate it—and everything depends on who is making it.
item.dc:creator: Alex Ross

item.title: How to Both-Sides a “Civil War”
item.description: In his new film, Alex Garland seems to be trying to have it both ways, using our dire politics as buzzy I.P. while tap-dancing around conversations that might get him in trouble.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Marantz

item.title: Donald Trump’s Very Busy Court Calendar
item.description: The first criminal trial of a former President starts this week. After all the legal posturing, the action will finally get real—that’s the theory, anyway.
item.dc:creator: Amy Davidson Sorkin

item.title: The Vatican’s Statement on Gender Is Unsurprising, and a Missed Opportunity
item.description: A new document that strives to reconsider matters of human dignity nevertheless echoes Church rhetoric from decades ago.
item.media:keywords: Religion, Catholicism, Pope Francis, Anthropology, LGBTQ
item.dc:creator: Paul Elie

item.title: Joe Biden and U.S. Policy Toward Israel
item.description: After six months of war, has Israel’s killing of World Central Kitchen aid workers compelled the President to do more to save lives in Gaza?
item.dc:creator: Evan Osnos

item.title: Inside Israel’s Bombing Campaign in Gaza
item.description: The Israeli journalist Yuval Abraham on his investigations of the I.D.F.’s use of A.I.-backed targeting systems and the dire cost to Palestinian civilians.
item.media:keywords: Israel, Israelis, Gaza, Palestine, Palestinians, Israel Defense Forces (I.D.F.), Artificial Intelligence (A.I.)
item.dc:creator: Isaac Chotiner

item.title: Why Israel’s Approach to Civilian Casualties May Not Affect U.S. Support
item.description: An analyst with the International Crisis Group on how strikes are being carried out in Gaza and whether the Biden Administration is ignoring American laws by continuing to provide Netanyahu with military aid.
item.media:keywords: Israel, Hamas, Gaza, War, Humanitarian Aid, War Crimes, International Law
item.dc:creator: Isaac Chotiner

item.title: Biden’s Increasingly Contradictory Israel Policy
item.description: A former State Department official explains the Administration’s sharpening public critique of Israel’s war and simultaneous refusal to “impose a single cost or consequence.”
item.media:keywords: Israel, Gaza, U.S. Foreign Policy, Joe Biden
item.dc:creator: Isaac Chotiner

item.title: The Brutal Conditions Facing Palestinian Prisoners
item.description: Since the attacks of October 7th, Israel has held thousands of people from Gaza and the West Bank in detention camps and prisons.
item.media:keywords: Palestine, Palestinians, Israel, Israelis, Prisons, Prisoners
item.dc:creator: Isaac Chotiner

item.title: Donald Trump Did This
item.description: On abortion, Arizona, and the 2024 Presidential election.
item.media:keywords: Abortion Rights, Abortion, Roe v. Wade, Donald Trump, 2024 Presidential Election, Audio
item.dc:creator: Susan B. Glasser

item.title: Will Historic Job Growth Bring an End to the “Vibecession”?
item.description: The Labor Department’s March employment report shows the U.S. economy continuing to power ahead. Yet many voters’ perceptions remain stubbornly negative.
item.media:keywords: Inflation, Joe Biden, Economy, Economics, Politcs, 2024 Presidential Election
item.dc:creator: John Cassidy

item.title: Israel’s Momentous Decision
item.description: After Iran’s dramatic but largely ineffective attack, Benjamin Netanyahu’s response will have tremendous consequences.
item.dc:creator: Dexter Filkins

item.title: Donald Trump’s Trial of the Century
item.description: Manhattan prosecutors have argued that the Stormy Daniels case—the first criminal trial of a former President in American history—is about much more than hush money. And legal experts believe that a conviction is likely.
item.media:keywords: Donald Trump, Stormy Daniels, Trials, Manhattan, District Attorney, Courtroom
item.dc:creator: Eric Lach

item.title: Is This Israel’s Forever War?
item.description: Foreign-policy analysts whose careers were shaped by the war on terror see troubling parallels.
item.media:keywords: Israel, Israelis, Palestine, Palestinians, Gaza, U.S. Foreign Policy, War on Terror
item.dc:creator: Keith Gessen

item.title: How a Republican and a Democrat Carved out Exemptions to Texas’s Abortion Ban
item.description: Rare across-the-aisle coöperation in Austin aims to protect some people who need abortions and the doctors who provide them. Plus, a band rehearsal with the songwriter and actor Maya Hawke.
item.category: Podcast / The New Yorker Radio Hour
item.media:keywords: Podcasts, Abortion Rights, Texas, Stranger Things, Abortion, Audio

item.title: What Phones Are Doing to Reading
item.description: It’s becoming harder, or at least less common, to read the old-fashioned way. But the new ways of reading are not all bad.
item.dc:creator: Jay Caspian Kang

item.title: Watching the Eclipse from the Highest Mountain in Vermont
item.description: People cracked cans of beer and smoked cannabis and popped mushroom gummies and ate smoked-meat sandwiches as totality approached at fifteen hundred miles per hour.
item.media:keywords: Solar Eclipse, Astronomy, Vermont, Sightseeing, Wonder
item.dc:creator: Nick Paumgarten

item.title: Nayib Bukele’s Authoritarian Appeal
item.description: El Salvador’s President has targeted critics, sent troops into the legislature, and violated the country’s constitution to maintain his hold on power. Why is he still so popular at home and abroad?
item.media:keywords: El Salvador, Central America, Gangs, Elections
item.dc:creator: Danielle Mackey

item.title: Waking Up to a New York City Earthquake
item.description: After the most powerful quake in more than a century, the city was full of stories, arm-waving, and whispers of California.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Larson
